radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal without focal or textural abnormality. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder contains several calcified gallstones. A 13 x 9 mm non-shadowing stone or sludge ball is present within the gallbladder neck or cystic duct. The gallbladder is distended, but there is no wall edema or pericholecystic fluid. The common duct measures 5 mm and there is no intra- or extra-hepatic bile duct dilatation.
